sections.heading: Removing Items
sections.description: There are several methods to remove items from a dictionary:

code_blocks.notes: The pop() method removes the item with the specified key name:

The popitem() method removes the last 
  inserted item (in versions before 3.7, a random item is removed instead):

The del keyword removes the item with the specified 
  key name:

The del keyword can also delete the 
  dictionary completely:
code_blocks.code:
thisdict =	{

»»"brand": "Ford",

»»"model": "Mustang",

»»"year": 1964

}
del thisdict
print(thisdict) #this will cause an error because "thisdict"
»»no longer exists.

code_blocks.notes:
The clear() method empties the 
  dictionary:
